content: I have no solution, but something external to thunderbird is preventing the prefs.js file in the profile from being updated at shutdown. it could be an antivirus or other software, or even that the prefs.js is read-only.
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest you first view the account online to confirm the folders are there.
creator: davidsk

content:
The mail server responded. Blacklisted by spam filter.

As stated, the message is from your email provider's server. Thunderbird has got nothing to do with this.

Please contact customer service.

This is exactly what you'll have to do - talk to your email provider.
creator: christ1

content: I share your concern, as I also prefer plain text. This is a bug in 140 that I reported recently. That feature is NOT there anymore. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1976738 I do not know when it will be done. This can probably fixed with CSS, but that skill is over my head. If I locate a temporary solution, I will share with you.
creator: davidsk
